timeline.summary: This document is an official FBI record regarding a death investigation. The record includes phone records for MCC Caller Station 6317, provided by the Office of Inspector General (OIG) on October 16, 2009. The case ID is 90A-NY-3151227, involving Jeffrey Epstein as a victim and classified as an UNSUB(S) death investigation.

This document is an email return concurrence form (ED-1036 Rev. 10-16-2009) related to a death investigation, Case ID #: 90A-NY-3151227. The email concerns Jeffrey Epstein as a victim and was drafted on 09/05/2019. It was approved by SSA and marked as UNSUB(S).

This document is a redacted FBI import form, FD-1036, related to a death investigation involving Jeffrey Epstein. The form was drafted on 2025-12-27 and references an OIG referral (CIA-2019-05324) received on 10-16-2009, categorized as “Other.” The case ID is 90A-NY-3151227, noting Epstein as a victim and the investigation’s focus. It includes a facial record dated 09/23/2019.

This document is an import form related to a case file (90A-NY-3151227) concerning the July 23, 2019 suicide attempt of Jeffrey Epstein. The form includes a photograph of a homemade rope taken from the scene. The document identifies Jeffrey Epstein as a victim and indicates an ongoing death investigation. It references serial 81 within the case file.

On August 10, 2019, at 4:30 PM EDT, one Seagate Barracuda 500GB HDD (Serial Number 23T6CF5X) was collected from a redacted location as part of an investigation related to Jeffrey Epstein’s death. The evidence originated from a Nice Vision DVR2 Surveillance System and was submitted under case ID 90A-NY-3151227. The receipt was not given. The item is designated as original and numbered as 1.

On August 10, 2019, at 4:30 PM EDT, one Hitachi 500GB HDD (Serial JP1572JE36MWNK) was collected from a redacted location as part of a death investigation (Case ID: 90A-NY-3151227). The HDD was recovered from a MCC Nice Vision DVR2 Surveillance System and submitted under NYC023582. Receipt was not given.

On August 10, 2019, evidence was collected from the MCC and New York Presbyterian Hospital related to a death investigation involving Jeffrey Epstein. The collected items included a torn sheet, clothing released from New York Presbyterian Hospital, and miscellaneous papers along with an MP-3 player. The evidence was logged under case ID 90A-NY-3151227, serial 43, and was seized by SA personnel. The items were located in Cell #220 of the Special Housing Unit. Receipt numbers 1, 2, and 3 correspond to the collection of these items.

On August 10, 2019, at 4:30 PM EDT, one Seagate Barracuda 500GB HDD (Serial Number 9QM8MT9P) was collected from a redacted location by the MCC-NY. The item was part of a Nice Vision DVR2 Surveillance System and was submitted as evidence related to a death investigation (Case ID: 90A-NY-3151227). Receipt was not given.

On August 10, 2019, at 4:30 PM EDT, one Seagate Constellation ES 500GB HDD (Serial Number Z1M1PZPE) was collected from MCC-NY as evidence related to a death investigation (Case ID: 90A-NY-3151227). The evidence originated from a Nice Vision DVR2 surveillance system (7 of 18). Receipt was not given. The document is an item log from the Federal Bureau of Investigation.

The FBI collected a Seagate Barracuda 1000GB hard drive (Serial Z1D3ZSS0) as a derivative copy of another Seagate Barracuda 500GB hard drive (Serial Z3T6CF5X). The original hard drive was collected via TX-1, S/N 000ECC58017156 on 08/12/2019 at 07:00. The evidence was labeled NYC027703 and associated with Request ID 112048. Jeffrey Epstein is listed as the victim in a death investigation.

This document is an import form, FD-1036, dated 09/24/2019, pertaining to a death investigation (Case ID 4: 90A-NY-3151227). The form includes phone records for MCC Caller Station 6385, provided by DIG SA on August 12, 2019. Jeffrey Epstein is identified as the victim. The form indicates UNSUB(S) and notes the investigation is regarding a death investigation.

This document is an FBI Import Form related to an investigation into the death of Jeffrey Epstein. It details the receipt of MCC Annual Refresher Training forms and records from OIG SA dated August 13, 2019, and identifies Case ID U: 90A-NY-3151227, with Jeffrey Epstein as a victim and the investigation as a death investigation. The form was drafted on September 25, 2019.

On August 14, 2019, at 04:30 PM EDT, one Seagate Barracuda 500GB HDD (S/N 9QM8MSRR) was collected from a redacted location as part of a death investigation (Case ID: 90A-NY-3151227). The evidence originated from a Nice Vision DVR2 Surveillance System and was received “No” by MCC-NY. The item was designated as “Original” and collected by an individual named “Seizing Indi.”

On August 14, 2019, at 4:30 PM EDT, one Seagate Barracuda 500GB HDD (Serial Number 9QM8EC75) was collected from a redacted location by the MCC-NY as part of a death investigation (Case ID: 90A-NY-3151227). The evidence was from a Nice Vision DVR2 Surveillance System. The receipt was not given.

This is an FBI Import Form (FD-1036) related to a death investigation. The case ID is 90A-NY-3151227, involving the victim Jeffrey Epstein. On August 14, 2019, a SIS Lieutenant provided a drawing of the MCC 10th Floor, as part of the investigation. The form was generated on December 27, 2025.

This document is an unofficial FBI import form (FD-1034) relating to a death investigation. The investigation concerns Jeffrey Epstein, identified as a victim. An SIS Lieutenant provided a drawing of MCC 9 South on August 14, 2019, dated September 25, 2019. The case ID is 90A-NY-3151227.

On August 15, 2019, Special Agent seized items 1820 and 1821 from the MCC (150 Park Row, New York, NY) at approximately 4:45pm, as documented by Lt. T. Doctor. An FD-597 receipt for government property is attached. The case is designated 90A-NY-3151227, a death investigation involving Jeffrey Epstein as a victim.

On August 16, 2019, a Seagate Barracuda 1000GB Hard Drive (S/N W1D48YH6) was collected as a derivative evidence item (NYCO27706) related to a death investigation. The drive contained a clone copy of a Seagate Constellation ES 500GB hard drive (S/N Z1M1PZPE), collected via Tableau TD3-B (S/N 11D350F0-1525). The request ID was 112048. The initial evidence item was collected on August 12, 2019, at 07:00 PM EDT.

On August 16, 2019, a Seagate Barracuda 1000GB HDD (S/N W1D496N0) was submitted as a derivative evidence item (NYC027709) related to case 90A-NY-3151227, a death investigation. The item is a copy of a Seagate Barracuda 500GB HDD (S/N 9QM8MSEZ) collected via Tableau TD3-B S/N 11D350F6-1525. The request ID was 112048. The collected date was August 12, 2019, at 07:00 PM EDT. One hard drive was collected.

On August 16, 2019, a Seagate Desktop 1000GB HDD (S/N Z4Y00Q48) containing a clone copy of a Western Digital 500GB HDD (S/N WCC2EJUC34CJ) was collected as a derivative evidence item (NYC027708) related to a death investigation. The collection was conducted via Tableau TD3-B S/N 01D3B08D-1331, Request ID 112048. The seized individual was Jeffrey Epstein, identified as a victim. The holding office is New York.

On August 16, 2019, a Seagate Barracuda 1000GB HDD (S/N S1D9GK9P) and a Seagate Constellation ES 500GB HDD (S/N Z1M1PZ07) were collected as a derivative copy of evidence NYC027713. The devices were collected via Tableau TX-1 S/N 000ECC58017194 and designated as a derivative copy with Request ID 112048. The collection occurred on August 12, 2019, at 07:00 PM EDT. The evidence relates to a death investigation involving Jeffrey Epstein.

On August 16, 2019, a Seagate Barracuda 1000GB HDD (S/N Z1DB25CT) and a Seagate Constellation ES 500GB HDD (S/N Z1M1PX26) were collected as a derivative copy of evidence NYC027710. The original evidence was collected via Tableau TD3-B S/N 01D3B09E-1331. The request ID was 112048. The seizure occurred on August 12, 2019, at 07:00 PM EDT. The items are designated as derivative and one device was collected.

On August 16, 2019, at 07:00 PM EDT, a Hitachi 1TB hard drive (HUA722010CLA330, S/N JPW9K0N039EZLL) was collected as a derivative evidence item (NYC027702) related to a death investigation. The hard drive contained a clone copy of a 500GB Hitachi HDD (HDS721050CLA662, S/N JP1572JE36A13K). The original collection was made via a Tableau TX-1 device (S/N 000ECC5801109B) and associated with Request ID 112048. The evidence was collected from a redacted location and held in New York.

On August 16, 2019, at 07:00 PM EDT, a Western Digital 1000GB HDD (WD1003FZEX-00MK2A0, S/N WCC3F2783519) containing a clone copy of a Seagate Barracuda 500GB HDD (ST350032ONS, S/N 9QM8MT6D) was collected. The evidence, designated NYCO27712, was collected via Tableau TX-1, S/N 000ECC58017156, and identified as a derivative copy. The request ID was 112048. The collected item is associated with a death investigation involving Jeffrey Epstein.

On August 16, 2019, a Seagate Barracuda 1000GB HDD (Serial W1D06T5L) was submitted as a derivative evidence item (NYCO27715) related to a death investigation. The HDD contains a clone copy of a Seagate Barracuda 500GB HDD (Serial 9QM8MSRR) collected via Tableau TD3-B (Serial 01D3B07E-1331). The collection occurred on August 12, 2019, at 7:00 PM EDT, and was seized by an unidentified individual. The item is held in New York.

On August 16, 2019, a Seagate Barracuda 1000GB HDD (S/N S1D9DETC) containing a derivative copy of a Seagate Constellation ES 500GB HDD (S/N Z1M1L0YG) was collected. The original hard drives were collected via Tableau TD3-B, S/N 11D350F0-1525. The request ID was 112048. The evidence was collected from [REDACTED] and held in New York. The item is designated as a derivative and one device was collected.

On August 16, 2019, a Western Digital 1TB hard drive (WD1DEADS-00L5B1, S/N WCAU45803950) was collected as a derivative copy of another Western Digital 500GB HDD (WD5000AVDS-6307B1, S/N WCAV92911026). The original drive was collected via Tableau TD3-B, S/N 01D3407C-1222, and identified as Evidence NYCO27707. The request ID was 112048. The seizure occurred on August 12, 2019, at 07:00 PM EDT.

On August 16, 2019, a Seagate Desktop 1TB hard drive (S/N Z4YDJL1T) was collected as a derivative copy of a Seagate Barracuda 500GB hard drive (S/N 9QM8MT9P). The original hard drive was collected via Tableau TX-1 S/N 000ECC58017194. The request ID was 112048. The evidence was collected from [REDACTED] and held in New York. The seizure occurred on August 12, 2019, at 07:00 PM EDT.  The item is designated as a derivative and is related to a death investigation involving Jeffrey Epstein.

On August 16, 2019, evidence NYC027711, a derivative copy, was submitted. The evidence consists of one Seagate Barracuda 1000GB HDD (S/N W1D48Z6E) containing a clone copy of a Seagate Constellation ES 500GB HDD (S/N Z1M1Q1FX). Both drives were collected via Tableau TX-1, S/N 000ECC58017139, on August 12, 2019, at 07:00 PM EDT. The request ID is 112048. The FBI holds the property and restricts distribution of this document.

On August 16, 2019, a Seagate Barracuda 1000GB hard drive (S/N S1D85PLA) was submitted as a CART Derivative Evidence (NYCO27701). The drive contained a clone copy of a Seagate Barracuda 500GB HDD (S/N 23T6C3JA) collected via Tableau TX-1, S/N 000ECC58017139. The request ID was 112048. The evidence was collected from a redacted location and held in New York.

On August 19, 2019, the NYPD transferred items 1B37 and 1B38 to the New York Office of the Chief Medical Examiner (NY OCME) for examination.  An evidence receipt was generated on August 12, 2019, at 11:56 AM documenting the transfer. The case ID is 90A-NY-3151227 and involves a death investigation with Jeffrey Epstein as the victim.

On August 21, 2019, items 1820 and 1821 were transferred from the OTD Digital Evidence Laboratory to SA and SA at approximately 12:06 AM. This transfer is documented within a chain of custody package (LA package) related to a death investigation involving Jeffrey Epstein, case ID 90A-NY-3151227.

On August 21, 2019, at 4:00 PM EDT, a Hitachi 2TB Hard Drive (S/N B9GMGTYF) was collected as evidence related to a death investigation involving Jeffrey Epstein. The drive contained verified E01 images designated NYCO23589, NYCO23593, NYCO23594, and NYCO23595. The evidence was submitted as a CART Derivative (Evidence NYCO23597) and is a master copy. The collection was conducted by the FBI’s CART-NY unit in New York.

On August 22, 2019, a WD Black 3TB hard drive (S/N WCC13LZR579P) was collected as evidence in Case ID 90A-NY-3151227, a death investigation. The hard drive contained verified E01 images numbered NYCO23578 through NYCO23592. The evidence was collected from a redacted location and held at the New York holding office.

This is an FBI import form related to a death investigation. On August 25, 2019, the Office of Inspector General (OIG) provided a computer analysis of the computers used by Michael Thomas and Tova Noel within the SHU of MCC. The case ID is 90A-NY-3151227, with Jeffrey Epstein listed as the victim. The form was approved by SSA and drafted on 09/26/2019.

On August 27, 2019, an FBI investigation (Serial 90A-NY-3151227) involving an Apple iPhone XS (IMEI: 1B44, iOS 12.4) was conducted. An ITS/Forensic Examiner performed a file system extraction using GrayKey v1.11.10 in response to MDUS request 110754. No unlock PIN was associated with the device. A SHA256 hash was generated, and extraction files were copied to an external hard drive. The extracted item and resulting evidence were returned to the New York CART, and the examination portion is considered complete. The document is FBI property and restricted for distribution outside the agency.

On August 28, 2019, evidence item 1844 belonging to MICHAEL THOMAS was returned to his lawyer, SHANNON FARRAR, as part of file number 90A-NY-3151227. This concurrence was received from the Assistant United States Attorney of the Southern District of New York.

This document is an “Other” Import Form related to a death investigation concerning Jeffrey Epstein. It was drafted on September 9, 2019, and references a memo from MCC dated August 10, 2019, provided by OIG SA. The case ID is 90A-NY-3151227 and identifies Epstein as a victim.

On September 9, 2019, the FBI received a document related to MCC 30-minute rounds conducted on August 5, 2019. The document, identified as FD-1036, includes round sheets provided by the Digital Investigation Group (DIG SA). The case ID is 90A-NY-3151227, and Jeffrey Epstein is identified as a victim in a death investigation.

This document is an unofficial FBI import form, dated September 9, 2019, related to a death investigation involving Jeffrey Epstein. It includes MCC count slips from August 10, 2019, provided by the Office of Inspector General (OIG SA), and identifies Case ID #90A-NY-3151227 and the status of the investigation as UNSUB(S).

On September 9, 2019, the Federal Bureau of Investigation received emails from mCc concerning suicide watch and psychological observation of Jeffrey Epstein, as part of a death investigation (Case ID: 90A-NY-3151227). The emails were provided by the Office of the Inspector General (OIG SA).

This document is an import form, dated September 9, 2019, related to a death investigation (Case ID: 90A-NY-3151227). The form details the provision of MCC 30-minute round sheets from August 6, 2019, by the Digital Investigation Group (DIG SA) to SSA. Jeffrey Epstein is identified as a victim in the investigation.

This document is an import form, dated September 9, 2019, pertaining to a memorandum from SOS R. regarding Jeffrey Epstein’s cellmate. The memorandum was produced on August 12, 2019, and is linked to Case ID 90A-NY-3151227, categorized as a death investigation with Jeffrey Epstein identified as a victim. The form was approved by SSA and drafted by the FBI.

On September 9, 2019, the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) received a document related to a death investigation (Case ID: 90A-NY-3151227) involving Jeffrey Epstein as a victim. The document consists of 30-minute round sheets from August 10, 2019, from 8:00 am to 12:00 am, provided by the Digital Investigation Group (DIG SA). The document was approved by the Social Security Administration (SSA).

This document is an FBI Import Form, dated September 9, 2019, regarding an email sent on UNET. The email, titled "Email Regarding MCC Staff Assignments on August 10, 2019," was forwarded by OIG SA to MCC SIS Lt. on August 11, 2019. The case ID is 90A-NY-3151227, and Jeffrey Epstein is identified as a victim in a death investigation.

This document is an official report from the Federal Bureau of Investigation's Digital Evidence Laboratory (DEL REX) regarding the examination of evidence items 1B1 to 1618. The report, dated 09/10/2019, details the uploading of a CART Process Report for cloning and imaging processes related to a death investigation involving Jeffrey Epstein as a victim (Case ID: 90A-NY-3151227). The report is classified as UNCLASSIFIED.

This document is an unofficial Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) Import Form, dated September 10, 2019, pertaining to a death investigation. The form, identified as FD-1036, includes a 30-minute round sheet provided by OIG SA regarding MCC ZB on July 27 and 29, 2019. The case ID is 90A-NY-3151227, and the victim is Jeffrey Epstein, with the investigation categorized as a death investigation.

This is a physical cover sheet for a serial export related to a psychology report and interview notes. The report and notes were acquired on 2019-09-11 and were associated with case SDNY_00017782, serial 182, and identification EFTA00035718.

On September 13, 2019, an email was provided by Dr. regarding Jeffrey Epstein needing a cellmate after being removed from psych observation. The email was dated July 30, 2019, and is related to a death investigation (Case ID 90A-NY-3151227) involving Jeffrey Epstein as a victim. The email was approved by SSA and drafted as part of a redacted file.

This is an FBI Import Form (FD-1036) dated 09/23/2019, related to a death investigation involving Jeffrey Epstein. The form is an “Other” type, specifically a “MCC Duty Officer Supplement,” approved by SSA. The Case ID is 90A-NY-3151227, and the investigation is classified as UNSUB(S); VICTIM; DEATH INVESTIGATION.  The document is designated UNCLASSIFIED and includes the identifier EFTA00035732.

This document is a Physical 1A/1C Cover Sheet for a serial export (Serial 125, 1A57). It pertains to package copy 1B44, involving evidence ruled to be null by SA per EC, and subsequently returned to SDNY_00017781. The export occurred on 2019-09-24 and is associated with EFTA00035717.

This document is an “Evidence Return” import form (FD-1036) from the FBI, Case ID #90A-NY-3151227, related to a death investigation involving Jeffrey Epstein as a victim. Evidence package 1B44 was returned on 8/28/19 by SA per EC 8/29/19 Ser. 68.

This document is an “Import Form” regarding the MCC bed assignments for Jeffrey Epstein, dated September 25, 2019. It was provided by SIS Lt. on August 13, 2018, and is part of a death investigation case ID # 90A-NY-3151227, designating Epstein as a victim and noting the involvement of SSA approval.

This is an FBI import form, FD-1036, dated September 25, 2019, regarding a death investigation. The picture of Tova Noel was provided by OIG on August 14, 2019. Jeffrey Epstein is listed as a victim. The case ID is 90A-NY-3151227.

This is an unofficial FBI import form, FD-1036, dated September 25, 2019, pertaining to a death investigation. The form details an inmate log from August 9 and 10, 2019, provided by OIG, referencing Jeffrey Epstein as a victim and case ID 90A-NY-3151227. The document was received on October 16, 2009.

On September 25, 2019, an “Import Form” was created for a drawing titled “(U) MCC Suicide Watch 2nd Floor Drawing.” The drawing was provided by SIS Lt. on August 14, 2019, in connection with a death investigation involving Jeffrey Epstein, identified by Case ID 90A-NY-3151227, categorized as UNSUB(S) and a DEATH INVESTIGATION.

This document is an FBI import form, FD-1036, related to a death investigation. The form includes a facial record of Michael Thomas, dated September 25, 2019, provided by OIG SA on August 14, 2019. Jeffrey Epstein is identified as a victim. The case ID is 90A-NY-3151227.

This document is a Physical 1A/1C Cover Sheet for a serial export (Serial 147, 1A65) related to EFTA00035771. It details acquisition information including the date (2019-09-26), the originating location ([REDACTED]), and an attached letter (U) Letter, SDNY_00018013.

This document is a Form 583 Report of Incident, dated October 3, 2019, regarding Jeffrey Epstein’s death investigation. The report was provided by the Digital Investigation Group (DIG SA) on August 14, 2019. The case ID is 90A-NY-3151227, and Jeffrey Epstein is listed as the victim. The form is classified as UNCLASSIFIED.

On November 14, 2019, an email was sent by an AUSA to summarize a telephone conversation between the AUSA, another AUSA, Dr. (OCME), and Dr. (OCME Chief Legal Counsel) regarding the autopsy of Jeffrey Epstein. The email, identified as Form FD-1036, was part of a death investigation (Case ID: 90A-NY-3151227) and included Jeffrey Epstein as the victim.

This is an official FBI Import Form, dated November 21, 2019, titled “CART Process Report for CART Submission ID:218509.” The report relates to a death investigation with Jeffrey Epstein as a victim (Case ID S: 90A-NY-3151227) and was approved by the SSA. The form is marked as UNCLASSIFIED and includes the case number EFTA00035749.

On December 4, 2019, AUSAs, along with a DIG SA, interviewed EMPLOYEE 32 (Jeffrey Epstein) regarding institutional counts performed at MCC. This interview was documented in an email sent to investigating agents. The case ID is 90A-NY-3151227.

This document is an unofficial Federal Bureau of Investigation Import Form, dated December 11, 2019, related to a digital evidence examination. It concerns Process Report #223558 regarding CART technical assistance for case ID #90A-NY-3151227, involving Jeffrey Epstein as a victim and a death investigation. The form was received on October 16, 2009.

This document is an Import Form created by the FBI, Case ID #90A-NY-3151227, related to a death investigation involving Jeffrey Epstein. The form, dated December 13, 2019, was provided by the OIG SA and includes OIG Waiver Forms and references to documents SONY_00017816 and EFTA00035752. The form indicates UNSUB(S) and Jeffrey Epstein as the victim.

This document is a redacted FBI import form (FD-1036) regarding a death investigation involving Michael Thomas. The form, dated December 13, 2019, details a work schedule provided by the Social Security Administration (SSA) on September 6, 2019. Jeffrey Epstein is listed as a victim, and the case ID is 90A-NY-3151227. The document is classified for release to the USA, Great Britain, and Ireland.

This is a redacted FBI Import Form, specifically a Daily Assignment Log for Tova Noel, dated December 13, 2019. The log was generated by the OIG as part of a death investigation (Case ID: 90A-NY-3151227) involving Jeffrey Epstein as a victim. The document is officially approved by the SSA and designated as UNCLASSIFIED.

This document is a Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) import form, specifically an "Other" type, relating to a death investigation. The form, dated February 4, 2020, includes a psychology report and interview notes for the case ID 8: 90A-NY-3151227, involving Jeffrey Epstein as a victim. The report is classified as UNCLASSIFIED and designates the case as UNSUB(S).

This is an email record from the Federal Bureau of Investigation, dated October 14, 2020, related to a death investigation identified as Case ID 8: 90A-NY-3151227. Jeffrey Epstein is listed as the victim. The email is part of a continuation chain (Ro 10-16-2009) and is classified as UNCLASSIFIED.

This document is an Intake Screening Phone Log related to a death investigation, Case ID 90A-NY-3151227, involving Jeffrey Epstein as a victim. The log was provided by the OIG Special Agent on 11/3/2020 and dated 03/04/2021. It is associated with the EFTA00035758 file.

On December 6, 2022, the U.S. Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General’s New York Field Office received a case closing communication from the FBI regarding their investigation into the death of Federal Bureau of Prison inmate Jeffrey Epstein. The FBI determined there was no criminality related to Epstein’s death and closed the case (90A-NY-3151227) on December 5, 2022. An electronic communication detailing the case closing was attached.

This document is an unofficial FBI import form, Case ID #90A-NY-3151227, related to a death investigation involving Jeffrey Epstein. It was generated on December 27, 2025, and includes waiver forms provided by the OIG SA, specifically referencing SONY_00017817 and EFTA00035753. The form indicates the subject is UNSUB(S), Jeffrey Epstein (victim), and the date of the investigation is December 13, 2019.
